column2: Brainware University  is offering 55+ UG, PG, and doctoral programs to over 15,000 students in the coming session. There will be 500 plus faculties and 200 marketing persons, while another 300 will be working in administration, accounts, law, security, and so on. Job Title:  Graphic Designer Job Description :  A graphic designer will be responsible for creating visually appealing content that communicates ideas and messages effectively through various media. This role involves designing layouts, graphics, and user experiences for websites to produce compelling graphics for a wide range of projects ensuring they are aligned with the organization's branding and requirements. Please note, teaching will remain an important part along with commercial and promotional activities for the university. Key Responsibilities: Create visually appealing graphics, illustrations, and layouts that align with the project objectives and brand guidelines. Develop and maintain a consistent visual identity and style across all design materials, ensuring alignment with the organization's requirements. Utilize design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other tools to create and edit graphic content. Select and apply appropriate fonts and typography to enhance the visual impact of designs. Edit and manipulate images and photos to enhance their quality and relevance to the project. Use knowledge of color theory to choose suitable color schemes that resonate with the target audience and message. Create graphics for various purposes, including marketing collateral, websites, social media, advertisements and printed materials. Conducting classes and guiding students of the multimedia department. Qualifications: A Master's degree in graphic design, visual arts, or a related field. Proficiency in software skills Illustrator especially Adobe Creative Suite, Photoshop, Creative designing, Making Illustrations. Minimum 5 years of relevant experience. Excellent understanding of design principles, layout, and typography. Knowledge of current design trends and Pentab. A fine arts background candidate is preferred Optional Skills: Animation and video editing skills. Web design and development knowledge (HTML, CSS). 3D modeling and rendering capabilities. Job Types : Full-time, Permanent Salary : As per market standard / depending on the experience of the candidature. Benefits : In addition, to salary, Medical Insurance, Paid Leave, Provident Fund, Gratuity, and Incentives for career development are also available as per University norms. Places of Work: Both Salt Lake and Barasat Interested candidate please send your cv at  sumita.hr@brainwareuniversity.ac.in   or whatsapp your cv in  7059594190

column2: Job description Job Title: Soft Skills Trainer Department: Training And Development Location: GLA University Mathura Position Type: Full-Time GLA University Mathura GLA University is a leading institution committed to providing a holistic and enriching educational experience. With a focus on academic excellence, we strive to nurture well-rounded individuals equipped with not only technical skills but also essential soft skills that are crucial for personal and professional success. Job Summary: The Soft Skills Trainer at GLA University will play a pivotal role in fostering the development of essential interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills among our students. This position involves designing and implementing comprehensive soft skills training programs to empower students to thrive in both academic and professional settings. Responsibilities: 1. Curriculum Development: - Design, develop, and update soft skills training programs tailored to meet the evolving needs of students. - Collaborate with academic departments to integrate soft skills modules into the broader curriculum. 2. Training Delivery: - Conduct engaging and interactive soft skills training sessions for students through workshops, seminars, and one-on-one coaching. - Utilize diverse teaching methodologies to cater to different learning styles and preferences. 3. Assessment and Feedback: - Develop assessment tools to evaluate students' soft skills proficiency. - Provide constructive feedback to students and work with them to create personalized improvement plans. 4. Stay Updated on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of industry trends and changes to ensure that the soft skills training programs remain relevant and effective. 5. Collaboration and Networking: Collaborate with faculty, staff, and external professionals to enrich the soft skills training programs. Build and maintain partnerships with industry leaders for potential guest lectures and workshops. 6.Documentation and Reporting: - Maintain accurate records of student participation and progress in soft skills training programs. - Prepare regular reports for university administration on the impact and effectiveness of the programs. 7. Professional Development: - Engage in continuous professional development to stay current with the latest methodologies and best practices in soft skills training.
column11: Soft Skills, Personality Development, Training And Development, Training Management, Behavioural Training

column2: Interested candidate can share resume at   namita.budholiya@vgos.org Requirement is for Part Time Gymnastics coach for three days in a week. Primary Purpose:  The Coach is responsible for facilitating academic and sports atmosphere where students have opportunities to explore their mental and physical talents contributing to their overall development by helping them to lead an active and healthy lives. Key Accountabilities/Activities:  Primary Responsibility: Student Administration  The Coach should ensure that the student growth and achievement is continuous and appropriate for a specific age group and develop desirable personal and social attributes: the concept of fair play, the acceptance of success and failure, and the ability to co-operate in group situations. The following are the areas to be focused on:  Should be approachable and treat students fairly and objectively.  Inculcate discipline in and out of the training sessions.  Treat children with dignity and respect.  Promote maximum student participation and interest and assist students in analyzing and improving fitness.  Monitor student progress constantly and adjust pace accordingly.   Conduct checks for improperly dressed students during SPA.   Keep a check on basic hygiene, is aware of the previous history of each child and attends to health matters seriously and diligently .  Ensures the safety of players through careful planning of practice sessions, use of equipment and games.  Ensures the development of students at a level of skill and competence necessary for Competition at the school level.  Coach should familiarize (himself/herself) with the SPA Manual, the Teachers Manual and the Parent Manual,(which includes the details in regards to SPA, Special Education and QAG) thoroughly to understand the core functions and style of working of the organisation.  Special Events To lead the development of a high performance programme that aims to achieve the highest result possible in inter school competitions. To search for, select, develop and maximise the potential of the School Team and to increase the number of players reaching the very highest levels of state and national performance  Be actively involved in the planning, organising and coordination of the Annual Sports Day. Participate in organizing and implementing the special events of the school. Assist in public relations events and other special events sponsored by school. To notify the SPA Coordinator in advance of any tournaments, practice session etc. To be responsible for the conduct and sportsmanship of his/her students during practice, at competitions and in public when representing the school. SPA Functioning To implement SPA training sessions, training rules and a system of play and scouting program suitable to the sport as per the SPA curriculum. To assume responsibility for equipment and materials issued and ensure that all are returned in good condition. For all daily practice sessions, the coach should arrive at the court dressed for practice at least 5 minutes before the beginning of practice. He, or she, should review the day's scheduled practice. The coach should be sure that the necessary materials are available. To provide constant supervision of the players at practice facilities and remain until all athletes have dispersed. To design and implement high quality periodised training and competition programmes for students. Secondary Responsibility: Coaches will remain present at PTMs. They will maintain and keep individual and team assessment records and share them with players and parents at the PTM.  Coaches will assemble a brief scouting report for every game, especially playoff games. Review the report with team at practice sessions before each game. To report injuries of participants to the SPA Coordinator.  At the conclusion of the month submit monthly assessment reports and a summary of monthly activities report to the SPA coordinator Committed to continuous personal and organisational improvement. The Coach should follow professional etiquette consistent with school systems and policies while working with students, parents, and colleagues. Maintenance of Records Be aware in terms of the process & maintenance of Records as per guidelines mentioned in the SPA Manual. Compile and maintain appropriate, accurate, complete, and correct records and provide relevant, accurate and up-to date information for school systems. Maintain confidentiality of students records. Maintain Records of : Attendance Register Class list Assist the Coordinator to update records in regards to events such as  a) Sports Day b) PTMs c) Camps, Tournaments and Competitions d) School Team Records e) Monthly Assessment Records f) Equipment Records g) Student Participation and Achievement Records h) Training Session Sheets

column2: Overview  The quality of school education available to students from low-income communities across India is abysmal. Their chances of getting admitted to a college or building a career are much lower than their high-income peers, condemning them to a life without voice or choice. iTeach was born to declare war on this status quo and create a level playing field for ALL children. We do this in Pune and Navi Mumbai by co-creating contextual school models with Municipal Corporations. We run 10 free and high-impact secondary schools and a college-to-career program for the most disadvantaged students. In 2024, with a staff of 250 members across 10 schools, we will serve 3000 students and 2000 alumni - giving students a fighting chance at college, career, and citizenship. We aim to grow to 30 schools and 10,000 students over the next five years.  Role Summary At iTeach, the School Principal is the CEO of the school. Along with the vice-principal and/or lead teachers, they are responsible for the management and development of their team (typically comprising twenty staff members), the holistic learning for each student, and the rapid progress of the entire school towards its vision. The School Principal also leverages donors, government officials, program partners, and community leaders towards achieving their school goals. Lastly, the School Principal is a part of the iTeach Leadership Team and consequently plays a vital role in shaping the entire organizations strategy and growth. Responsibilities The responsibilities broadly fall into three categories: School Design, Team Management, and Stakeholder Investment. I. School Design Develop a three-year vision and strategy for your school Design the student week, unit, and year, keeping your school context and resources in mind Manage the schools operations, including systems for facility management, data recording and submission, and government permissions (in collaboration with our Network Team) Create and sustain a nurturing and high-performing staff and student culture Monitor all aspects of the schools day-to-day functioning and make progress towards the school vision, achieving better results with every passing year Systematize the documentation of best practices and resources to assist other schools Collaborate with the Finance Team and optimize the school budgets to equip the team best II. Team Management Get to know each staff member deeply, and co-create ambitious end-of-the-year goals Coach staff members in various aspects of their work (design, execution, and reflection) Review the progress of each staff member quarterly, and assist in identifying critical levers for improvement in the next quarter Define and build a healthy and high-performing staff culture, lead regular culture norming meetings to ensure alignment and refinement of your culture Collaborate with HR to ensure win-win career paths for staff members and their retention III. Stakeholder Investment Cultivate deep partnerships with local elected leaders and education officers to reach your school goals Work closely with the School Management Committee and parent body to leverage their support. Leverage our funding and volunteering partners to provide your staff and students with the resources they need to succeed Experience and Competencies Exceptional performance as a teacher for 3-4 years Overall work experience of 7+ years, with success in leading 10+ member teams  Proficient in project management Ability to lead a team independently and deliver strong results Preferred: Experience in coaching and development of teachers Salary - Salary is decided based on the candidate's education and work experience. Our compensation for this role lies between 10 to 14 Lakh Per Annum.

column2: The BT Assistant in the Department of Tamil will be responsible for teaching Tamil language to students in grades 9-12. The specific responsibilities.           Responsibilities.         Develop and deliver lessons: The B.T. Assistant will develop and deliver lessons to students in Tamil language. They will prepare lesson plans, lecture notes, assignments, and assessments to evaluate student learning.     Grade assignments and exams: The B.T. Assistant will grade assignments, exams, and other assessments in a timely and objective manner. They will provide constructive feedback to students and help them improve their Tamil language skills.     Classroom management: The B.T. Assistant will maintain a positive and productive learning environment in the classroom. They will enforce discipline and ensure that students follow school policies and rules.     Curriculum development: The B.T. Assistant may be responsible for developing or revising the Tamil language curriculum based on the schools goals and objectives. They will keep up-to-date with the latest teaching methodologies and instructional technologies to enhance the learning experience.     Student engagement: The B.T. Assistant will encourage student engagement and participation in class. They will facilitate discussions, debates, and other activities that promote critical thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration among students.     Academic advising: The B.T. Assistant may provide academic advising to students on matters related to Tamil language studies. They will work closely with other faculty members, administrators, and parents to ensure that students are receiving the support they need to succeed.     Professional development: The B.T. Assistant will engage in ongoing professional development activities to enhance their teaching skills and knowledge of Tamil language. They may attend conferences, workshops, or other training programs to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and practices in language education.             Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Tamil or related field.     Experience teaching Tamil language to students in a secondary school setting.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work collaboratively with other faculty members.     Proficiency in Tamil language.         Eligible fields:         Bachelors degree in Tamil language     Bachelors degree in any other language with a focus on Tamil language     Bachelors degree in Education with a focus on Tamil language     Bachelors degree in Literature with a focus on Tamil language     Bachelors degree in Linguistics with a focus on Tamil language         Note:               Salary for all positions will be based on qualification and experience and will not be a limiting factor for the right candidate

column2: We are looking for a highly-motivated and experienced person to lead our digital literacy training team and help us to effectively reach, and enrich the digital knowledge and experience of thousands of online users, mostly women, through our Productive Paths project.        Responsibilities/Scope of Work:        Design, develop, implement, and deliver online and classroom courses focusing on digital literacy and online skills development. More specifically:              Design and develop online digital literacy and online skills training modules with clear goals objectives and lesson plans. These models will make use of collated and self-created online materials and manuals (videos, texts), interactive online tools and live online training activities, and assessments that are appropriate to the skill level, needs, and interests of the project participants.      Design, develop and direct the implementation of live training programs aimed at augmenting the online courses and activities.      Perform administrative duties related to training to include preparation of project planning, performance and status reports, training evaluation and assessments, and participation in overall project report preparation and presentation.      Work closely with Project Leader and project to ensure timely and effective project implementation.              Qualifications / Skills / Experience          Digital Literacy Instructor must have the following knowledge, skills and/or abilities.              Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be fluent (reading, speaking, writing) in English and in Hindi at a minimum.      Proven experience in development and dissemination of online and live training activities, preferably related to the use of computers and connectivity and connectivity-related tools.      Good knowledge of online tools (browsers, social media, video conferencing, business tools and application)      Good knowledge of PC/online tools (Microsoft Office and similar tools, accounting and administrative tools, etc.) an asset.      Bachelors degree and/or certification in development of training materials in a relevant field an asset.      Teaching experience with low-literacy adult language learners preferred      Strong, proven, commitment to diversity, with respect and sensitivity to cultural and educational differences.      Understanding of cultural and linguistic barriers to education and experience in overcoming these for participants, in particular adult learners.      Able to adjust personal schedule to participate in weekend and/or evening events as needed. Instructors commit to long hours of work when necessary to meet the needs of participants.      Consistent and dependable. Carrying out work in a timely manner, adhering to schedules, tasks, and timelines as agreed with Project leader.      Experience in working in rural areas a plus.      Willingness to travel and work in rural areas as part of your work

Provide academic and career guidance to students.          Service:          Participate in departmental meetings, committees, and other administrative activities.      Contribute to the development and assessment of academic programs.      Engage in outreach activities to promote the department and university.          Professional Development:          Stay current with advancements in the field of computer science.      Attend conferences, workshops, and seminars.      Engage in professional organizations and networks.      Qualifications:      Masters in Computer Science or a closely related field.      Demonstrated excellence in teaching at the undergraduate and/or graduate levels.      A strong record of research productivity with publications in reputable journals and conferences.      Ability to secure external funding for research projects is desirable.      Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

column2: To be successful as a trainer, one should have strong analytical and observational skills.        Teacher Trainer Responsibilities:        Observing lessons and identifying teachers strengths and weaknesses.      Providing feedback, advice, and individual training sessions for teachers.      Organizing workshops, training sessions, and events where guest speakers inspire teachers.      Collaborating with teachers and other staff to develop improved curricula, lesson plans, assessments, and classroom management techniques.      Setting weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly goals for teachers as well as students, and providing advice and guidance to ensure these goals are met.      Returning to classrooms to reassess progress once teachers have completed their training.      Supervising classroom activities, taking notes, and writing up reports to share with school administrators and relevant stakeholders.      Developing new strategies and plans for an improved learning experience.      Keeping abreast of developments in teaching as well as your relevant subject area.      Building teacher networks and encouraging teachers to share their resources and knowledge.        Teacher Trainer Requirements:        Master s degree in education or the subject discipline.      Extensive teaching experience in the subject area or a related discipline.      Experience teaching adults might be advantageous.      Strong planning and organizational skills.      Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.      Patience and resilience.      A high degree of diplomacy.      Great conflict resolution skills.      A valid driver s license.
column11: Training, Conflict resolution, Analytical, Management, Supervision, Teaching
